indicator_name: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
indicator_available: Proportion of population reporting to have experienced discrimination or unfair treatment in the past 5 years
SDG_GOAL: Goal 10: Reduce inequality within and among countries
SDG_TARGET: Target 10.3: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 10.3.1: Proportion of population reporting to have experienced discrimination or unfair treatment in the past 5 years
STAT_CONC_DEF:
This indicator measures the proportion of population reporting to have experienced discrimination or unfair treatment over the past five years based on any of the following factors:
- Indigenous identity;
- Ethnicity or culture;
- Race or skin colour;
- Religion;
- Language;
- Accent;
- Physical appearance;
- Sex;
- Sexual orientation;
- Gender identity or expression;
- Age;
- Physical or mental disability;
- Any other specified reason.
DATA_COMP: Data were readily available to report on this indicator as specified by the metadata. Please refer to the sources to access additional information on the metadata or source.
REC_USE_LIM:
This is a proxy indicator. The UN Global indicator states: “Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law”.

The total for Canada does not include data from the territories.

The discrimination indicators in the primary series, "Proportion of the population reporting experiences of discrimination or unfair treatment," uses the total population as the denominator. The secondary series, "Proportion of individuals within a population who reported experiencing discrimination or unfair treatment," calculates the indicator based on the population of individuals who report such experiences, rather than employing the total population as the denominator.

fr.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicateur 10.3.1 : Proportion de la population déclarant avoir été victime de discrimination ou de traitement injuste au cours des 5 dernières années
fr.STAT_CONC_DEF:
Cet indicateur mesure la proportion de la population déclarant avoir été victime de discrimination ou de traitement injuste au cours des 5 dernières années en raison de l’un des motifs suivants :
- identité autochtone;
- appartenance ethnique ou culturelle;
- race ou couleur de peau;
- religion;
- langue;
- accent;
- apparence physique;
- sexe;
- orientation sexuelle;
- identité ou expression de genre;
- âge;
- incapacité physique ou mentale;
- toute autre raison spécifiée.
fr.DATA_COMP: Data were readily available to report on this indicator as specified by the metadata. Please refer to the sources to access additional information on the metadata or source.
fr.REC_USE_LIM:
Il s’agit d’un indicateur de substitution. L’indicateur mondial des Nations Unies indique : « Proportion de la population ayant déclaré avoir personnellement fait l’objet de discrimination ou de harcèlement au cours des 12 mois précédents pour des motifs interdits par le droit international des droits de l’homme ».

Le total pour le Canada n’inclut pas les données des territoires.

Les indicateurs de discrimination de la série primaire, « Proportion de la population déclarant avoir été victime de discrimination ou de traitement injuste », utilisent la population totale comme dénominateur. La série secondaire, « Proportion d’individus dans une population déclarant avoir été victimes de discrimination ou de traitement injuste », calcule l'indicateur sur la base de la population d'individus qui déclarent de telles expériences, et non sur la base de la population totale comme dénominateur.
